ArrayLike()

A class used solely to indicate that an object is an "array like" It should never be used directly and is a temporary hack around some poor design decisions.
Source:
  • utils.js, line 372

deprecate(context, name, message, fn)

Define a deprecated method or property. A warning message will be displayed the first time the method is called, regardless of the object.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
context Object The context for the method.
name String The name of the deprecated method.
message String The message to display.
fn function The function to call, it should restore the real property.

escape(input) → {String}

Escape the given input for use in a query. > NOTE: Because of a fun quirk in OrientDB's parser, this function can only be safely used on SQL segments that are enclosed in DOUBLE QUOTES (") not single quotes (').
Parameters:
Name Type Description
input String The input to escape.
Source:
  • utils.js, line 131

extend(source) → {function}

Make it easy to extend classes.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
source Object [description]
Source:
  • utils.js, line 30
Returns:
[description]
Type
function
Example
extend a class

   function Parent () {

   }

   Parent.extend = utils.extend;

   var Child = Parent.extend({
     '@foo': 'bar',
     'greeting': 'hello world'
   });

   Child.foo; // => 'bar'

   var child = new Child();
   child.greeting; // => 'hello world'

jsonify(value, indentlevel) → {String}

Safely encode a value as JSON, allowing circular references. When a record is encountered more than once, subsequent references will embed the record's RID rather than the record itself.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
value Mixed The value to JSON stringify.
indentlevel Integer The indentation level, if specified the JSON will be pretty printed.
Source:
  • utils.js, line 256
Returns:
The JSON string.
Type
String

transform(transformer) → {Query}

Transform the returned results. Accepts either a single function, which will be passed the entire record / row as first argument, OR, an object where each key on the object will be used to transform properties of the same name in the result set.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
transformer function | Object The transforming function or map of functions.
Source:
  • db/query.js, line 16
Returns:
The query object.
Type
Query
